DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Biological Entity Ethnic Group Code OMOP CDM Ethnicity Concept Identifier
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: OMOP CDM:The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.0.2 and OMOP value set for CDM. DW 07-20-2020 Updated definition.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Health Care Provider Identifier PCORnet CDM Provider Identifier
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Arbitrary identifier for each unique record. Does not need to be persistent across refreshes, and may be created by methods such as sequence or GUID. Provider code is for the provider who is most responsible for this encounter. For encounters with multiple providers choose one so the encounter can be linked to the diagnosis and procedure tables. As with the PATID, the provider code is a pseudoidentifier with a consistent crosswalk to the real identifier.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Date and Time Range PCORnet CDM Specimen Collection Date
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._Date specimen was collected.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. Not all laboratory tests are differentiated by fasting status. For laboratory tests where fasting status is not considered to interpret results, Fast_Ind is marked X (not applicable). For laboratory test results where fasting status may be considered to interpreting results (e.g., glucose), Fast_Ind is marked F (fasting) only if the source data included with the laboratory test result indicates fasting test. All other laboratory test results where fasting status may be considered that is not explicitly marked as fasting, Fast_Ind is marked R (random).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Date and Time Range ACT I2B2 CDM Specimen Collection Date and Time
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._Date and time specimen was collected. If times dont exist in the source data, set HH:MM:SS to 00:00:00.

DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.0.2 and i2b2 ACT value set for CDM.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Immunization Vaccine Expiration Date
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.:As part of the CGMP regulations, the FDA requires that drug products bear an expiration date determined by appropriate stability testing (21 CFR 211.137 and 211.166), after which the product may not meet the appropriate regulatory agencies requirements..
